title: The True Enemy
opening: To liberate the people of the Western Isles once and for all, Roy headed for Jutes, the Isles' largest city. The Etrurian capital was located there. Lord Arcard, the supervisor of the mining operation on the Isles, resided in Jutes. According to Elffin, Arcard was of high birth, but he held no importance in the Etrurian court. Roy was still worried about Etruria's response to his attacking the capital, but he had no choice if he was going to rescue the people.

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: S-S... Sir Flaer!

intro.speaker: Flaer
intro.line: Lord Arcard. Why do you fret so?

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: It's the Lycian Army! They come for my blood!

intro.speaker: Flaer
intro.line: Yes, they have been a thorn in Bern's side for some time... We knew it would be difficult if they became too friendly with Etruria. That's why we had you send them here. It seems, however, they fight even better than expected.

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: You don't understand the gravity of this situation! Do you realize how much I've lost thanks to their meddling? All the riches I've gotten from these islands are gone! ...And on top of that, now they want my life! Once they arrive, my legacy is finished! My hands are shaking. I don't know what to do...

intro.speaker: Flaer
intro.line: My, how you worry. I suggest you flee to Etruria.

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: You will allow it?

intro.speaker: Flaer
intro.line: Warfare is Bern's strong suit. We also have our secret weapon ready to brandish. With it we shall erase the Lycian Army once and for all.

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: But...

intro.speaker: Flaer
intro.line: Lord Arcard. Once Bern and Etruria join forces, we will have nobody to fear. Am I wrong?

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: No... No! You're right. I leave them to you.

intro.speaker: Flaer
intro.line: Hmph, cowardly Etrurian nobles. If we defeat the Lycian Army here, the Isles shall be ours...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: This is the capital... Once we take it, we can finally go home.

intro.speaker: Elffin
intro.line: I have already sent someone in to unlock the gate... Oh, there she is.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: The one over there dressed like a dancer?

intro.speaker: Elffin
intro.line: Yes, that's her.

intro.speaker: Larum
intro.line: Your Majesty! Over here!

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Your Majesty?

intro.speaker: Elffin
intro.line: ...I know not of what she speaks.

intro.speaker: Larum
intro.line: Your Majesty! You're late.

intro.speaker: Elffin
intro.line: Larum, why do you call me "Your Majesty"?

intro.speaker: Larum
intro.line: Huh? …Oh! Ah... er… Well, you know, you look like royalty, so it's your nickname!

intro.speaker: Elffin
intro.line: My apologies, Lord Roy. This is Larum, a member of the resistance.

intro.speaker: Larum
intro.line: You're Roy? Everyone on the Isles has heard of you! They all call you the Savior from the East. Nice to meet you! I'm Larum.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Whoa! Please leave a little distance!

intro.speaker: Larum
intro.line: Roy, your face is all red. How cute!!

intro.speaker: Elffin
intro.line: ...Larum...

intro.speaker: Larum
intro.line: Oh! R-right... There's something I should tell you. I've been hearing strange rumors. The people here say that an "unhuman" resides in this castle.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: An "unhuman"...?

intro.speaker: Larum
intro.line: Oh, yes. They say he changes form into something that looks like a dragon!

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: A human? That can change into a dragon?!

intro.speaker: Larum
intro.line: I don't know... but that's what I hear.

intro.speaker: Elffin
intro.line: We must proceed with caution.

battle.speaker: Flaer
battle.line: I will make a report about the Lycian Army to General Narcian. I want you to defend the castle while I am away.

battle.speaker: Flaer
battle.line: Hm? Who's there?! …… Just the wind...? Ahem. I will take my leave now. I leave them to your discretion.

battle.speaker: Flaer
battle.line: Ha ha… The Lycian Army will hardly be able to stand against this dragon. Normal weapons won't even scratch it's skin. These manaketes… They certainly are terrifying beasts.

battle.speaker: Raigh
battle.line: So that's what the "unhuman" is. Bern really has brought dragons into this world. ...What to do now...? I guess I'll pose as a soldier and observe the dragon's power.

battle.speaker: Cath
battle.line: La la la la la, la la la la la… All the way out here in the Isles West, folks work to death for nobles in their nest! This castle's sure to be brimming with treasure! All this loot was stolen anyway. Might as well take it off these nobles' hands.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: The reinforcements from the south will arrive shortly!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: That guy gives me the chills...

battle.speaker: Soldier 1
battle.line: Did you handle the cave on the outskirts of town?

battle.speaker: Soldier 2
battle.line: Yes, sir. The bandits have blocked off all entrance to it. No one will be able to get to the legendary weapon now.

battle.speaker: Soldier 1
battle.line: Excellent! Now all we have to do is clean up the Lycian Army.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: That was not an easy battle... The dragons' power is truly... Horrific.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: An unhuman... Now I understand.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: How many of these dragons does Bern have...? How can we be expected to be victorious against monsters like these?!

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Lord Roy! Keep a level head.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Ah...

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: ...I understand your worries. But if you panic, that feeling will spread to the army. You must remember that.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...I'm sorry.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: It is a perfectly understandable reaction after a fight like that. But... we also gained knowledge that we did not have before.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What knowledge is that?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Don't you remember? I told you Arcard was rumored to be working with Bern.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Oh, that's right! If Bern's dragons are in an Etrurian castle...

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Arcard has indeed made a deal with Bern.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...That means Lycia is in danger... We must return to the mainland. We have to contact General Cecilia and conceive a plan...

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Lord Roy, before returning to the mainland, there is a matter to take care of.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: More bandits?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: No, thankfully. A legendary weapon is hidden in a cave not far from here. If we obtain it, we can fight the dragons more effectively.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: A legendary weapon... You're right! If we can get all eight of them, we might have a chance of defeating Bern!

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Yes... We must find as many as we can.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Then let's go to the cave and get it!

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: R-report! I have a message from Etruria... A revolution has broken out in Aquleia, the capital of Etruria.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: What?!

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: The ones leading the revolution are High Chancellor Roartz and Lord Arcard. They have captured King Mordred. They also say they plan to divided dominion of the continent between Bern and Etruria!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: The two strongest nations in Elibe joining forces...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Is General Cecilia all right?! And what of Princess Guinivere...

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: We don't have any current information... But the three Etrurian Generals have parted ways and are working separately. Mage General Cecilia has fled Aquleia for the Missur Peninsula in the southwest.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: And the other Generals?

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: They're with the revolutionaries against their will because the king was taken hostage.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Lord Roy...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: We need to contact General Cecilia... Princess Guinivere… Please be safe...

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: Oh! You!

recruit-talk.speaker: Cath
recruit-talk.line: Hm? ...You again? You always come and mess up my plans. Do you have it out for me or something?

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: No! I just... wanted to apologize.

recruit-talk.speaker: Cath
recruit-talk.line: ...Excuse me?

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: The last time we met, I was pretty callous. I said you shouldn't steal, but I didn't even realize what you'd been through...

recruit-talk.speaker: Cath
recruit-talk.line: Oh that? Whatever. I don't care.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: But I still think what you do is wrong.

recruit-talk.speaker: Cath
recruit-talk.line: You've got some nerve, you know that?

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: Just give me a chance.

recruit-talk.speaker: Cath
recruit-talk.line: A chance?

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: Once this war is over, I promise to help rebuild your village. I'll be sure the taxes are put to good use too. Just please, stop looting.

recruit-talk.speaker: Cath
recruit-talk.line: …… How long will that be?

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: Whenever this war ends. I can't say when...

recruit-talk.speaker: Cath
recruit-talk.line: And you expect me to wait patiently until then?

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: No. All I want is your faith.

recruit-talk.speaker: Cath
recruit-talk.line: ...Why are you so kind to me? I'm just a thief.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: Without you, we wouldn't have escaped Wagner's trap. Maybe you didn't care about helping us, but the fact is that you did. You saved our lives. You're more than just a thief.

recruit-talk.speaker: Cath
recruit-talk.line: If things keep going like they have... I guess you'll get in my way no matter where I go.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: As long as you appear in our path.

recruit-talk.speaker: Cath
recruit-talk.line: Fine, you win. I'll stop looting battlefields.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: You will? Thank you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Cath
recruit-talk.line: But I'm coming with you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: What? Why?

recruit-talk.speaker: Cath
recruit-talk.line: Actions speak louder than words. Prove to me that you'll be true to your promise.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roy
recruit-talk.line: I won't disappoint you!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lugh
recruit-talk.line: Raigh? Raigh! It's so good to see you!

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: Lugh...! What are you doing here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lugh
recruit-talk.line: I'm glad you're OK. We were all worried about you. I know you wanted to train your magic skills, but you left so suddenly.

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: I couldn't have learned magic if I'd stayed at that orphanage. It was a miracle I picked up as much as I did.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lugh
recruit-talk.line: Raigh… The orphanage is gone.

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: What? What happened?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lugh
recruit-talk.line: Bern came... and burned it down.

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: ...What happened to everybody?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lugh
recruit-talk.line: Poppa was killed trying to protect us... The young children are under the care of the St. Elimine Church now.

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: ...I see. It's for the best... They'll be happier at the church than at that dilapidated orphanage.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lugh
recruit-talk.line: You don't have to be so callous about it.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lugh
recruit-talk.line: Raigh! Come with us. We'll defeat Bern, and then we can go back to the children!

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: Sorry, not interested.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lugh
recruit-talk.line: But--

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: Then again... the Lycian Army might be good company. They're sure to come across more dragons at some point. All right, you got me. I suppose I'll go with you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lugh
recruit-talk.line: Raigh...

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: I just want you to know one thing. I'm not joining to avenge Poppa or the orphanage!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lugh
recruit-talk.line: I know, Raigh.

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: Then stop looking at me like that!

recruit-talk.speaker: Chad
recruit-talk.line: Raigh! What are you doing here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: My thoughts exactly, Chad. What happened to the orphanage?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chad
recruit-talk.line: ...I knew you'd be concerned. You ran off, but I knew you'd never forget us.

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: I was never concerned. I was just curious.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chad
recruit-talk.line: ...The orphanage is gone.

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: What do you mean?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chad
recruit-talk.line: Bern's troops burned it to the ground when they invaded Lycia. Poppa... He couldn't...

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: What?! They killed Poppa...?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chad
recruit-talk.line: I'm going to avenge him. We're stuck on these Isles now. But I know we'll go back and fight Bern full force some day...!

recruit-talk.speaker: Chad
recruit-talk.line: I suppose there's no point in telling you, though, is there?

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: ...I'll go with you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chad
recruit-talk.line: What?! Are you serious?

recruit-talk.speaker: Raigh
recruit-talk.line: Bern has a deep connection with the dragons. I want to learn more.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chad
recruit-talk.line: ...So that's it. Fine. Just don't get in my way.
